user.description: Flux will update the temperature and brightness of your lights based on the time of day. During the day they will be bright, and they will gradually dim and fade to a red/orange at night. It will only affect lights that are turned on and listed below.

data.name: A name for your flux configuration

init.description: Flux will update the temperature and brightness of your lights based on the time of day. During the day they will be bright, and they will gradually dim and fade to a red/orange at night. It will only affect lights that are turned on and listed below.

data.name: A name for your flux configuration
data.lights: Select the lights you want controlled by Flux
data.start_time: Start time. If left empty this will be automatically calculated based on the location. To reset this value set it to 13:37
data.stop_time: Stop time. If left empty this will be automatically calculated based on the location. To reset this value set it to 13:37
data.mode: Select how color temperature is passed to lights
data.transition: Transition time for the light changes
data.interval: Time between between consecutive light updates

future_yaml_deprecation.title: Flux YAML configuration will eventually be removed
future_yaml_deprecation.description:
Flux integration can now be configured from the user interface.

Eventually, support for configuring Flux via YAML will be phased out.
This transition will occur once code has been written to convert existing Flux YAML configurations into config entries.

You could be the one to write this code!
Click "Learn more" to learn more

Until then, you'll encounter a somewhat persistent, albeit slightly annoying, notification. =)

deprecated_yaml.title: Flux YAML configuration is being removed
deprecated_yaml.description:
Configuring Flux using YAML is being removed.

Your existing YAML configuration has been imported into the UI automatically.

Remove the Flux YAML configuration from your configuration.yaml file and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.
